title: An industrially potent rhamnolipid-like biosurfactant produced from a novel oil-degrading bacterium, Bacillus velezensis S2
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,24516-24533
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02572E, Paper

Shahnaz Sultana, Rokaia Sultana, Md. Abdullah Al-Mansur, Md. Ahedul Akbor, Nasrin Akter Bhuiyan, Shamim Ahmed, Sabina Yasmin, A. H. M. Shofiul Islam Molla Jamal
An oil-degrading bacteria, Bacillus velezensis S2, was found to produce rhamnolipid-like biosurfactant which showed significant emulsification and foaming activity while reducing the surface tension remarkably. This offers more ecological sustainability than the toxic chemical surfactants.
